articles.author: Tasneem Akolawala
articles.title: Realme Pad India Launch Teased by CEO Madhav Sheth, Will Feature a Slim Design - Gadgets 360
articles.description: Realme India and Europe CEO Madhav Sheth has teased the arrival of the Realme Pad tablet in India. The side profile of the tablet has been teased and it is seen to sport an edge-to-edge finish with a slim profile. It is also teased to be lightweight.
articles.content: Realme Pad is teased to launch in India soon. The tablet has been leaked several times in the past. Now, the company's India and Europe CEO Madhav Sheth has confirmed its impending arrival. He shared… [+2070 chars]

articles.author: ANI
articles.title: New COVID-19 strain: Mandatory RT-PCR test for those arriving in Mumbai from Europe, China, Middle East - Zee News
articles.description: After the discovery of a new strain of the COVID-19 variant C.1.2, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has made the RT-PCR test mandatory for international passengers arriving at the Mumbai airport from September 3.
articles.content: MUMBAI: After the discovery of a new strain of the COVID-19 variant C.1.2, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has made the RT-PCR test mandatory for international passengers arriving at the… [+1383 chars]

articles.title: Europe's health agency says no urgent need to roll out COVID-19 booster shots to fully vaccinated - CBC.ca
articles.description: The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control says that, based on available data on vaccine effectiveness, there was no urgent need for the administration of booster doses of COVID-19 vaccines to fully vaccinated individuals.
articles.content: The global debate over COVID-19 vaccine boosters is continuing, with Europe's health agency now saying there is no need to rush another round of shots even as multiple countries are doling out additi… [+2819 chars]

articles.author: The Irish Times
articles.title: New coronavirus strain designated a variant of interest by WHO - The Irish Times
articles.description: Mu first identified in Colombia in January with cases also recorded in Europe
articles.content:
A new coronavirus strain, named Mu, has been designated a variant of interest by the World Health Organisation (WHO).
Mu, or B.1.621, was first identified in Colombia and cases have been recorded in… [+1097 chars]
